column1: Halfast "Hal" Gamgee was a Hobbits of the Shire.
Hal was the son of Halfred of Overhill
column2: an uncle of Samwise Gamgee. He worked for Boffin Family in Overhill
column3: and often went up in the Northfarthing to hunt.

column1: He had the reputation for his wild stories of things he saw. He reportedly encountered a "Ents" while hunting beyond the North Moors.
The name likely comes from Old English hālfæst meaning "hale and firm".
